I’m working on a PR (Update to bookworm by PeterJohnson · Pull Request #233 · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub). It builds an image that mostly works, but the network settings page in the webpage is broken because the new OS version switched to NetworkManager.

Thanks for working on this Peter! We can’t wait to try out our new Pi5s for this year’s tag and game piece recognition.

We’re hoping for fewer false positives with the new tags, and faster frame rates with the new Pis and libraries.

We really appreciate your efforts!

Is there a new wpilibpi image for 2024? I can’t see any updates on the git. The 2023 version does not seem to have the robotpy with wpimath’s objectToRobotPose, so what we’ve been testing on windows updating the pose from tags can’t easily be transfered to the pi.
Thanks!

I stalled out on making the webserver changes, but I can release a “beta” 2024 image (with the latest 2024 released libraries) on Friday.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T08:04:55.338Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":90.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":445489,"topic_slug":"wpilibpi-on-raspberry-pi-5","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32094,"username":"CJ_Hill","name":"CJ Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/wpilibpi-on-raspberry-pi-5/445489/8","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328400,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T05:52:24.499Z","cooked":"

I just released a 2024.1.1-beta-1 release. This bookworm-based image has WPILib and RobotPy 2024.3.1, as well as Raspberry Pi 5 support. The main thing that I know is broken is the ability to change network settings via the webdash.

GitHub

Release WPILibPi 2024.1.1 Beta 1 · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi

This is the initial beta release of WPILibPi for 2024. The major update for 2024 is the OS is now Bookworm-based and supports the Raspberry Pi 5. Known issues: Only the base vision processing ima...

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T05:52:24.499Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":101.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":445489,"topic_slug":"wpilibpi-on-raspberry-pi-5","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/WPILibPi/releases/tag/v2024.1.1-beta-1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Release WPILibPi 2024.1.1 Beta 1 · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub","clicks":55}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32094,"username":"CJ_Hill","name":"CJ Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/wpilibpi-on-raspberry-pi-5/445489/9","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328931,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T07:53:31.430Z","cooked":"

Thanks!
I downloaded and put on our code. So far it works great. No problem configuring cameras despite messages about
mount: /boot: mount point not mounted or bad option. dmesg(1) may have more information after failed mount system call.
Still trying to figure out how to assign a static IP on bookworm . It didn’t allow me to save changes with sudo nmtui, so I just made a /etc/network/interfaces.d/eth0 with the following contents (We’re 2429, and I like having the pis at 12, 13, etc):

allow-hotplug eth0
iface eth0 inet static
address 10.24.29.12/24
netmask 255.255.255.0
gateway 10.24.29.1

I hope I’m missing something obvious here but when I attach local Module 3 Standard 12MP cameras to either/both camera connectors I receive the following error

CS: ERROR: ioctl VIDIOC_QBUF failed at UsbCameraImpl.cpp:723: Invalid argument (UsbUtil.cpp:156)
CS: WARNING: rPi Camera 0: could not queue buffer 0 (UsbCameraImpl.cpp:724)

Thanks for any pointers that can lead me down the proper path.

Has anyone tested cscore with the new libcamera stack? You might be stuck using libcamera directly

Maybe the WPILib Apriltag detector and pose estimator are out of scope of the WPILibPi. It looks like it would be close to working but I have a few jar files missing on the example project. Maybe the native files don’t exist and the detector and estimator will never be part of WPILibPi. They are too slow on the roboRIO and I thought the RPi might be workable.

Maybe the native files don’t exist and the detector and estimator will never be part of WPILibPi.

To get the example Java to show well in VSCode “precompile” on my Windows 10 PC and to build I added
build.gradle implementation files('jackson-annotations.jar') implementation files('wpiunits.jar') (stolen from a roboRIO project)

Opencv version was 460 in build.gradle so I changed to 480.

Then I ran the build on the RPi and got this error

Starting camera ‘rPi Camera 0’ on /dev/video0

@Peter_Johnson I also attempted to build the Java example on my RPi 4 hopeful that the error if using the laptop VSCode would go away. The RPi will not resolve Internet names but URL and *.local works. Thus the ./gradlew build failed because it wants to download a zip from services.gradle.org. The RPi can access that gradle address 104.16.73.101 which doesn’t help me, of course.

Using the same Ethernet port on my WI-Fi extender my laptop can resolve names. The WPILibPi was configured to use DHCP. The laptop has two options that must be selected - Obtain an IP address automatically and Obtain DNS server address automatically.
Thanks for your help.
